channel.description: Recent content in lc_dp on Siwei's Blog

item.title: 509 Fibonacci Number
item.description: The Fibonacci numbers, commonly denoted F(n) form a sequence, called the Fibonacci sequence, such that each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, starting from 0 and 1. That is, F(0) = 0, F(1) = 1 F(n) = F(n - 1) + F(n - 2), for n > 1. Given n, calculate F(n). Example 1: Input: n = 2 Output: 1 Explanation: F(2) = F(1) + F(0) = 1 + 0 = 1.

item.title: 1137 N-th Tribonacci Number
item.description: The Tribonacci sequence Tn is defined as follows: T0 = 0, T1 = 1, T2 = 1, and Tn+3 = Tn + Tn+1 + Tn+2 for n >= 0. Given n, return the value of Tn. Example 1: Input: n = 4 Output: 4 Explanation: T_3 = 0 + 1 + 1 = 2 T_4 = 1 + 1 + 2 = 4 Example 2: Input: n = 25 Output: 1389537 Constraints:
